Bayer is amongst others directly member of the following European associations: 
 
BusinessEurope,  
European Chemical Industry Council (CEFIC), 
European Federation of Pharmaceutical Industries Association (EFPIA), 
the Association of the European Self-Medication Industry  (AEGSP)  
European Association for Bioindustries (EuropaBio),  
European Crop Protection Association (ECPA), 
European Seeds Association (ESA) 
AnimalHealth Europe 
 
The company is also supporting a network of stakeholders in the area of innovation, health, trade, agricultural and chemical policy, which includes:  
 
The European Risk Forum (ERF) 
The Center for European Policy Studies (CEPS) 
The Center for European Reform 
AMISA II
relevant_communication: Bayer accompanies, to a varying degree, all of its political initiatives and aims as well as their implementation with activities in the field of communication and public relations. In the last year this included engagement with media on innovation and science, as well as events in cooperation with other organizations. Bayer has set for itself highest ethical standards on engagement with media and makes its positions transparent to the public.
goals__remit:
Bayer is an innovation company with core competencies in the fields of health care and agriculture, developing new molecules for use in innovative products and solutions to improve the health of humans, animals and plants.    
 
Bayer has 99,592 employees as of 31 Dec.2017. Bayer's business is managed by three divisions: Pharmaceuticals, Crop Science and Consumer Health.
